medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset diffuse abdominal pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with a one-day history of sudden onset diffuse abdominal pain accompanied by nausea and multiple episodes of non-bilious non-bloody emesis. Denies fevers or chills. Bowel movements and diarrhea at baseline due to lymphocytic colitis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Esophagus paraesophageal hernia with erosions, lymphocytic colitis for 6+ years, anemia, depression, hypertension, history of spinal stenosis with 8 surgeries, hypothyroidism, osteopenia, history of alcohol use, tobacco abuse, lumbar and cervical stenosis, breast carcinoma status post right mastectomy, multiple surgeries for chronic back pain.
medical_history.family_history: Mother: CVA; Father: CAD; Siblings: sister died of CVA, sister with breast cancer.
